quizzes.question:
Create a valid HTML5 doctype:
[!raw!]
<{0} {1}>
<html>
<head>
<title>Title</title>
</head>
<body>
The content of the document
</body>
</html>
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]HTML5[/h1]

When writing HTML5 documents, one of the first new features that you'll notice is the doc type declaration: [code format="html"][b]<!DOCTYPE HTML> [/b][/code]
The character encoding (charset) declaration is also simplified: [code format="html"][b]<meta charset="UTF-8">[/b][/code]
[u][b]New Elements in HTML5[/b][/u]
<article>, <aside>, <audio>, <canvas>, <datalist>, <details>, <embed>, <footer>, <header>, <nav>, <output>, <progress>, <section>, <video>, and even more!
[note]The default character encoding in HTML5 is UTF-8.[/note]

quizzes.question: Which element/feature is not new in HTML5?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]New in HTML5[/h1]

[u][b]Forms[/b][/u]
- The Web Forms 2.0 specification allows for creation of more powerful forms and more compelling user experiences.
 - Date pickers, color pickers, and numeric stepper controls have been added.
 - Input field types now include email, search, and URL.
 - PUT and DELETE form methods are now supported.

[u][b]Integrated API[/b][/u] (Application Programming Interfaces) 
 - Drag and Drop
 - Audio and Video
 - Offline Web Applications
 - History
 - Local Storage
 - Geolocation
 - Web Messaging
[note]You will learn more about these new features in the upcoming lessons.
Tap the [b]Continue [/b]button to begin![/note]
